lines.text: Huck! Hey, Huck! Muff Potter's my friend. And when a friend's in trouble, you can't run away.
Oh Tom, it's, it's, what is it?
It's your engagement ring.
It's beautiful.
It sure is. Why when I was engaged to Amy Lawrence she...
What? You mean I'm not the first?
No Becky, that was ages ago. Two months at least.
I hate you. I hate you and I hope you die.
Muff's innocent Huck, we gotta help him.
We ain't gotta do nothing.
You'd let him hang for something he didn't do.
It ain't no skin off my back.
Hello Huck!
Hello yourself and see how you like it.
Watcha doin' down here?
Lookin for jackasses.
Under a bridge?
I found one, didn't I?
[both laugh]
Shall I get some more soap, mother?
[looks at Tom and grins]
I don't know why you're smilin', Sid. You're next!
[Injun Joe's about to stab Tom]
HEY!
[kicks Injun Joe]
I know you.

[Huck pushes Tom behind him]
Huck...
You're Pap Finn's boy... Blueberry.
Huckleberry.
Your daddy was the best knife fighter on the Mississippi. Did he teach you?
He taught me.
Ahhh then let's see what you got, river trash.
[laughs]

[pulls out knife]
I ain't river trash!
Come on!
[Huck swings knife, Injun Joe dodges]
[Injun Joe slams Huck into wall]
[small yelp]
You got guts boy. And in a minute they're gonna be on the ground.
Let's see ya hit this!
[turns around]
[holds chest over the hole]
NOOOOOO!
So why'd ya come back, Huck?
Figured if you did it alone, you'd probably splotch it up.
Yeah, probably.
I thought we was friends Huck.
You thought wrong. I ain't got no friends. Ain't got time for 'em. But if I did have one I'd want him to be like you.
According to this, you should be dead and rottin' right about now.
I had to help Muff. Not helpin' him woulda been wrong.
I know but, you swore an oath Tom, don't that mean anythin' to ya?
Of course it does. It's just, it felt like the right thing to do. Huck it was the right thing to do.
No. You swore an oath Tom, you swore.
What if we could get the map? That'd prove Muff's innocent and we wouldn't break our oath.
Only one problem. That map is in Injun Joe's pocket.
He sold it to Doug Tanner - No, wait. Mickey Douglas got the marble from his cousin in St. Louis... who traded it to Alfred Temple, who sold it to... Johnny Miller. No, wait. Alfred sold it to -
[Injun Joe picks him up by his collar]
Just tell me who owned it last, boy.
Tom Sawyer owned it last. But it don't matter now,'cause now Tom's dead.
That's too bad. I'm so sad.
[Drops Joe, who runs to the church]
Yeah, that's it. Run, fat boy! Run!
You gonna let her do that to you?
I think she likes me.
She pushes you off a bridge cuz she likes you?
[Tom nods]

[Huck blows smoke in Tom's face]
I think you're both crazy.
Hey Huck watcha got in the sack?
Dead cat. Wagon run over 'em. Guts come out both ends.
What's a dead cat good for?
To cure warts away.
Well, I got one. How's it work?

You take your dead cat to the graveyard on the day somebody wicked's been buried, and when the devil comes, you heave your cat at him and say "Devil follow corpse, cat follow devil, warts follow cat, I'm done with you". That'll fetch any wart.
Sounds right. So when are you gonna try it?
Tonight.
Lemme go with ya, Huck.

[shakes head]
You might get scared.
[at the graveyard]

[Huck making scary sounds]
Dead seems kinda lively tonight don't they?

[whirls around]
HAH!
[Tom yelps]
[Huck grins]
He's drunk asleep. Shouldn't be too hard to get that map.
Then let's get it and git.

[begins approaching Injun Joe, then notices Huck's not following]
Ain't ya comin'?
One map don't need the two of us. I'll wait here.
So why'd ya come back Huck?
When a friend's in trouble, you don't run away.
